commentBody:
NY Times should stop with articles like this.

It is not sufficient to write that some people believe that Bannon is anti-Semitic and/or racist and that some people think he is the best thing since sliced white bread. This kind of accusation and denial is not fair to Bannon, his accusers or defenders.

Instead, report on what statements or actions make people think that he is anti-Semitic and/or racists. Then his defenders can defend, and people can make their own judgments.

Of course, backing a candidate who did nothing to stop the vile comments from crowds at his rallies and encouraged targeting of reporters could lend some credence to such charges. On the other hand, maybe Conway and Bannon tried to encourage their candidate to display leadership.
